name: Ginger Snapper
author: christinatross
summary: Perfect if you're looking for a fast fish dinner without a long marinating time.
ingredients: 1 (2 inch) piece fresh ginger root, minced
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Spray a large sheet of aluminum foil with cooking spray
Thoroughly mix the soy sauce, honey, ginger, and garlic in a large bowl
Dip both sides of the fish into the soy sauce mixture, and place onto the aluminum foil
Spoon a little more sauce over the top of the fish
Roll up the aluminum foil to completely enclose the fillet
Bake in the preheated oven until the fish is opaque and flakes easily, about 20 minutes
